About.text: Innovathon’21 is DTU’s first official Hackathon spanning multiple engineering domains. The hackathon aims to invoke free thinking, innovation, and teamwork as participants rack their brains to come up with novel ideas and impactful solutions to showcase their innovation and engineering skills. Innovate, think, learn, implement while tackling some real-life problems. The 2021 edition of Innovathon will be conducted in online mode. Participate and win exciting prizes!

Themes.title: Full-stack Development
Themes.text: Test your expertise in creating user-friendly interfaces and coming up with intriguing solutions for challenging real life problems. Innovathon’21 will provide you hands-on experience to explore your potential in the field of Full stack development. Now is the chance to build an effective solution, web or mobile app, using all possible languages and frameworks with added business logic and user mindset.

Themes.title: Entrepreneurship
Themes.text: An entrepreneur is a person who has the possession of a new enterprise, venture or idea and is accountable for the inherent risks and the outcome. Entrepreneur is a term applied to a person who is willing to launch a new venture or enterprise and accept full responsibility for the outcome. Entrepreneurs are at the forefront of today’s techno-startup revolution. Are you ready to unleash the Entrepreneur within you and bring the change you want to see in the world?

Themes.title: Machine Learning
Themes.text: One of the hottest fields in innovation today is Machine Learning. At Innovathon DTU, we present to you a wonderful opportunity to put your machine learning skills to test, through a set of well-crafted problems, which demand extreme innovation and implementation skills. Are you up to the challenge?

Themes.title: Hardware / Robotics
Themes.text: Get ready to put your hardware programming skills to test!  The hardware challenge is all about building viable, ready to deploy solutions to real life problems ranging from everyday automation to medical and intelligent security systems.

Timeline.title: Registration starts
Timeline.content: Starting here, students may register for the Hackathon via Devfolio

Timeline.title: Round 1 submission
Timeline.content: The final deadline for participants to register and submit their ideas

Timeline.title: Round 1 Results
Timeline.content: Teams qualifying for Round 2 are announced

Timeline.title: Round 2 Submission
Timeline.content: The deadline for finalists to submit their solutions

Timeline.title: Round 2 Presentation
Timeline.content: The finalists pitch their ideas for our judges to evaluate

Timeline.title: Round 2 Results and Felicitation
Timeline.content: Winners of the hackathon are announced

FAQ.question: What is the registration fee for Hackathon?
FAQ.answer: There is no registration fee for DTU Innovathon’21.

FAQ.question: How to register for the event?
FAQ.answer: Registration for DTU Innovathon’21 can be done at DevFolio.

FAQ.question: How will the Hackathon be conducted?
FAQ.answer: The hackathon will take place in online mode.

FAQ.question: What are the formats for submission?
FAQ.answer: The submission format will be uploaded on this website as well as on Devfolio as soon as Round 1 begins.

FAQ.question: Will multiple submissions be allowed in one round?
FAQ.answer: Multiple submissions are not allowed by the same team for the same round. Teams should make one submission per round which would be considered final.

FAQ.question: When and where will I receive the problem statement?
FAQ.answer: Problem statement will be available to all participants on 3rd October 2021 00:00 IST on DevFolio and the official DTU Innovathon’21 website.

FAQ.question: Who can participate in the event?
FAQ.answer: Participation for this edition is confined to DTU students who are currently enrolled in a UG/PG course within DTU.

FAQ.question: How many people are allowed in a team?
FAQ.answer: There can be a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 4 members in each team.

FAQ.question: How long is the Hackathon?
FAQ.answer: Round 1 lasts for 10 days. Participants who qualify for round 2 will be up for a 120 hour long hackathon.

FAQ.question: Will a theme and problem statement be assigned to participants?
FAQ.answer: Participants are free to choose any problem statement from any theme.

FAQ.question: What technologies you must/must not use for Hackathon?
FAQ.answer: There are no restrictions on the use of technologies.

FAQ.question: Can you choose more than one theme?
FAQ.answer: No, participants should choose only one theme.

FAQ.question: Can I switch themes between rounds?
FAQ.answer: Participants have to stick with the same theme for both of the rounds .
